Adele,

I also started off from Mat Buckland's book, and have been working =
with a
modified version of his implementation. If you're particular about s=
ticking
with his implementation and C++ (his is a relatively simple impleme=
ntation
of NEAT from what I understand) I can send you my code if you want =
(buggy
work in progress).

It's not a simple example at all (competitive co=
evolution), but it would
give you some code examples and bug fixes to Mat B=
uckland's original
implementation (mine is a Linux port). Probably only use=
ful to you for
looking at the changes I made to Mr. Buckland's code, but th=
at would be
easy as most of the code is the same, and the classes retained =
their names
from those described in his book.

You might want to start with=
 getting his minesweeper (was that it?) example
application running, and tr=
y putting in some of the bug fixes folks have
recommended in his implementa=
tion (I think I can help find those). Once you
have that working, you might=
 want to try the XOR test, and perhaps pole
balancing. I believe those are =
common tasks to undertake.

Let me know if you want any code, or have any q=
uestions I might be able to
help with. I'm afraid I'm far from a NEAT guru,=
 but I don't think too many
folks are working with Mat Buckland's implement=
ation now. I think that's a
great book, and that chapter helped me consider=
ably in getting started
working with NEAT.


-Drew

utorial.
> Unfortunately I don`t have enough experience in C#.
>
> Sincerel=
y
> Adele
>

--20cf30050b6431ed2a04b36d96dd

Adele,<div><br></div><div>I also started off from Mat Buckland's book, =
and have been working with a modified version of his implementation. If you=
're particular about sticking with his implementation and C++ (his is a=
 relatively simple implementation of NEAT from what I understand) I can sen=
d you my code if you want (buggy work in progress).=A0</div>

<div><br></di=
v><div>It's not a simple example at all (competitive coevolution), but =
it would give you some code examples and bug fixes to Mat Buckland's or=
iginal implementation (mine is a Linux port). Probably only useful to you f=
or looking at the changes I made to Mr. Buckland's code, but that would=
 be easy as most of the code is the same, and the classes retained their na=
mes from those described in his book.=A0</div>

<div><br></div><div>You mig=
ht want to start with getting his minesweeper (was that it?) example applic=
ation running, and try putting in some of the bug fixes folks have recommen=
ded in his implementation (I think I can help find those). Once you have th=
at working, you might want to try the XOR test, and perhaps pole balancing.=
 I believe those are common tasks to undertake.=A0</div>

<div><br></div><d=
iv>Let me know if you want any code, or have any questions I might be able =
to help with. I'm afraid I'm far from a NEAT guru, but I don't =
think too many folks are working with Mat Buckland's implementation now=
. I think that's a great book, and that chapter helped me considerably =
in getting started working with NEAT.=A0</div>
